answers.author: Eric Eddy
answers.text:
After looking at our use agreement for transit shelters (similar to bus benches, but probably with greater aggregate advertising availability) it appears we receive the greater of $1,000 or 15% of gross advertising revenues, per shelter. We also reserve the right to conduct an audit to verify gross revenues.  
There are provisions for an increase in fees at certain time points, if desired, but to my knowledge those have never been acted upon.  
Let me know if there's anything else related to the agreement that you'd like to know.

author: Andrew Ellard
text: If your city has arranged for a private entity to place and maintain bus top benches and to sell the advertising space on them, I am interested in the terms involved.  Specifically, what percentage of gross revenues are paid to your City?  If there are other financial arrangements that are working well for your transit system's advertising, I would be interested to know that as well.
title: Public Transit Advertising
